name: Gillingham FC History Online Trivia | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1893.

	The club also moved into Priestfield Stadium in this year.

questions.text: What were the club first known as?
questions.explanation:
New Brompton.

	Between 1893-1913 the club was known as New Brompton, when they changed their name to Gillingham FC.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
W I Groombridge.

	Groombridge was manager between 1896-1906, followed by a second spell between 1908-19. In between his two posts, Smith took charge, and McMillan was manager from 1920-23.

questions.text: Which of these scored the most League goals for the club?
questions.explanation:
Brian Yeo.

	Yeo scored 135 League goals between 1963-75. He also set a record for the most League goals in one season with 31 in the 1973-74 Division Four season.

questions.text: From which club did Gillingham sign Vince Bartram in 1998?
questions.explanation:
Arsenal.

	Bartram began his career at Wolverhampton Wanderers, before moving on to Blackpool (Loan), West Brom (Loan), Bournemouth, Arsenal, Huddersfield (Loan), Arsenal, and finally Gillingham.

questions.text: In which season did Gillingham win their only Divisional title of the 20th century?
questions.explanation:
1963-64.

	Gillingham won the Division Four title this season with 60 points. Carlisle United also finished with 60 points, but it was Gillingham's title with a goal average of 1.97, compared to Carlisle's 1.95.

questions.text: Who did Gillingham beat 10-0 in a 1987 Division Three game to set the record for their biggest League victory?
questions.explanation:
Chesterfield.

	The game took place on 5th September, 1987.

questions.text: How many goals did Fred Cheesmur score in a Division Three (South) game against Merthyr Town in 1930?
questions.explanation:
6.

	The game finished 6-0 to Gillingham on 26th April, 1930.

questions.text: Where did the club sell striker Leo Fortune-West to in 1998?
questions.explanation:
Lincoln City.

	Fortune-West was sold by Gillingham on a free transfer to Lincoln, where he stayed for just five months. He later played for Brentford, Rotherham and Cardiff City.

questions.text: Which of these played the most games for Gillingham?
questions.explanation:
John Simpson.

	Simpson played 571 League games for the club between 1957-72.
